document_title: Abnormal uterine bleeding: Causes, diagnosis and treatment
subsection_name: xuat-huyet-tu-cung-bat-thuong.json_6_How to prevent abnormal uterine bleeding?
subsection_content:
Below are some measures to help prevent abnormal uterine bleeding that women need to know:
Do not arbitrarily or abuse taking hormonal drugs without consulting a gynecologist.; Clean daily, always keep the private area clean and dry.; Supplement all necessary nutrients, iron... as prescribed by your doctor and through your daily diet.; Visit a doctor immediately when you notice unusual signs to accurately determine the cause and have a timely and effective treatment plan.; Follow your doctor's instructions and recommendations during treatment for quick recovery.
In the context of the resurgence of the Covid-19 epidemic with changes in many strains of the SARS-CoV-2 virus, many pregnant women have to delay prenatal check-ups, losing the golden time to detect abnormalities during pregnancy. Understanding those difficulties, BS.CK II Nguyen Ba My Nhi, Director of the Obstetrics and Gynecology Center, along with skilled and experienced obstetrics and gynecology experts at Tam Anh General Hospital participated in answering questions of women through the program "ONLINE OBSTETRIC AND GYNECOLOGICAL CLINIC" every Tuesday, Friday and Saturday afternoon. Customers can view details of the program "ONLINE OBSTETRIC AND GYNECOLOGY CLINIC" and register for a free "online examination" with experts here. TAM ANH GENERAL HOSPITAL SYSTEM Hanoi:  108 Hoang Nhu Tiep, Bo De Ward, Long Bien District, Hanoi Hotline: 024 3872 3872 – 024 7106 6858 HCMC:  2B Pho Quang, Ward 2 , Tan Binh District, Ho Chi Minh City Hotline: 0287 102 6789 – 093 180 6858 Fanpage: https://www.facebook.com/benhvientamanh
Abnormal uterine bleeding can seriously affect quality of life, as well as lead to many dangerous complications that affect a woman's reproductive function, ability to get pregnant, and motherhood. Therefore, as soon as you detect signs of abnormal vaginal bleeding, women should immediately go to a medical facility for early examination and timely and effective treatment intervention!
